summary: The “Ending Punitive, Unfair, School-based Harm that is Overt and Unresponsive to Trauma Act of 2025” (Ending PUSHOUT Act of 2025) aims to reduce exclusionary discipline practices in schools. It mandates data collection on exclusionary discipline, provides grants for schools to implement alternatives, and establishes a joint task force to address the school pushout of girls of color. The bill prohibits various disciplinary actions and funds training, programs, and personnel aimed at improving school climate and student outcomes. It also authorizes significant appropriations for these initiatives.
